title: Original Mickey Mouse Club Mouseketeer Karen Pendleton dead at 73
text:
Karen Pendleton, who was one of the original Mouseketeers on The Mickey Mouse Club, has died aged 73.

The actress died in Fresno, California from a heart attack on Sunday according to Disney historian Lorraine Santoli via The Hollywood Reporter. She was born on August 1, 1946 in Glendale, California.

She was a trailblazer as she was one of the youngest members to ever join the cast at just age 8.

Sad: Karen Pendleton, who was one of the original Mouseketeers on The Mickey Mouse Club, has died aged 73

Pendleton remained a regular castmember for the entire show's run on ABC from 1955-1959. Only nine children total had done the same.

According to The Hollywood Reporter was discovered by Disney producers when they were stopping by dance schools searching for talent and was asked to audition.

She is best known her musical pairings with fellow Mouseketeer, Cubby O'Brien, including the song that would close out the show titled Alma Mater.

Trials and tribulations: In 1983 she (pictured in 1997) was involved in a car accident which paralyzed her from the waist down and needed a wheelchair for the rest of her life

Pendleton stepped out of the limelight once her time on the Disney series had ended as she left showbiz to finish high school.

She had one daughter named Staci in 1973 before ultimately divorcing in 1981.

Just two years later, she was involved in a car accident which paralyzed her from the waist down and needed a wheelchair for the rest of her life.

However, she did not let the unfortunate situation get in the way of achieving her goals as she later earned both her bachelor's and master's degrees in psychology.

Legend: Pendleton (pictured center bottom) was a trailblazer as she was one of the youngest members to ever join the cast at just age 8

According to THR, she went on to work at a shelter for battered women and became an advocate for those with disabilities when she became a board member for the California Association of the Physically Handicapped.

The Children's variety show was rebooted in 1977 and again from 1989-1994 which featured an all-star cast including Ryan Gosling, Britney Spears, Christina Aguilera, and Justin Timberlake.

Despite stepping out from the spotlight, Pendleton continued to stay in touch with her Mickey Mouse Club House castmates and often joining them for conventions, reunions, and events at Disneyland.

Back in the day: She is best known her musical pairings with fellow Mouseketeer, Cubby O'Brien, including the song that would close out the show titled Alma Mater

Her daughter Staci said in a statement to THR: 'My mom loved her Mouseketeer family.

'Getting together with them was always a high point. It gave her the opportunity to relive great memories and to meet so many Mickey Mouse Club fans that watched the show as kids and loved her. Many told her that they named their daughters Karen in her honor.'

Pendleton is survived by her daughter and two grandsons.
